intro: Androsace laxa, commonly known as the loose sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to alpine and arctic regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a mat-forming growth habit with numerous small, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pink, arranged in clusters and blooming in early summer. Androsace laxa is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous environments where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
